txt.en: Instance: Fram's Folly
'My friend, Fram. What can I do for you? We are brothers of the mountain after all.'
'I assure you that they were here when I arrived. I am in the midst of investigating this travesty.'
'Make no mistake, Fram was under the influence of a mix of dragon-magic and GÃºrzyul powers.'
'A curse? Such an accusation, my friend!'
'His will was strong to both make that map and to confront Karazgar.'
'I have done nothing that you did not agree to, remember this.'
'The blood pact was an oath for us both to uphold, afterall.'
'Karazgar!'
'How could I not?'
'Fram, Fram, my dear friend. I tire of this conversation.'
'Karazgar, it is urgent that I talk with you.'
'I have but one more task for you, Fram. Come, rest your corpse here, surrounded by the dwarves that you have slain.'
'You have served me well, and for that you have served my master's will.'
'Wait, why are there dead dwarves strewn about?!'
'Now, my friend, you are no longer of use to me.'
'I might have believed you in the past, but I do not believe you this time, Karazgar.'
'Good-bye, Fram.'
'Enough of your games! I have come here to ask what you have done to me!'
'The blood pact was a ruse!'
'Why, my disdain for the dwarves has only grown ever since we crossed paths!'
'Ugh!'
'It was never this way!'
'How... could... you...'
'I can not speak certain words in the company of others, as if something pulls me down.'
'You have cursed me! Admit it!'
'Fram was a kind-hearted Man, and Karazgar twisted that strength into a weakness.'
